nodes.bodyText: explain why an exception might be thrown, we already know it is an exception
no need to say "simple JUnit test file" -- just say what it does

changed to:

This JUnit test is used for testing
Wdt Config Override with Model File(s) to existing MII domain
no need to sat the method is called before every test, we know that already :)

change to:

This method creates the result/pv root directories for the test.
do we really  need to create operator before each test? seems a little heavy weight
Let me ask Vanaja this question

right, but you have this in a @beforeeach not a @BeforeAll
so this will do if for every test method, which is not what vanaja said -one per class

it may cause extra works if we wanted to merge "static staticPrepare()" and "non-static prepare()" methods, because:

in staticPrepare() , it calls a static method in its parent class, so this method has to be a static one
Creating Operator method calls non-static method in Operator.java and BaseTest.java, so I can't move it to staticPrepare()
Even though beforeEach annotation is used, Operator is still created once due to the condition check if)operator != null)
If we wanted to get rid of this beforeEach annotation when creating Operator, it need changes in our test framework.

after discussing with Mark, we will keep as it is for now
why?

I removed and change the doc to "to new config map" because cm name remains same.

Create a domain using model in image and having configmap in the domain.yaml
before deploying the domain. After deploying the domain crd,
re-create the configmap with a model file that define a JDBC DataSource
and update the domain crd to change domain restartVersion
to reload the model, generate new config and initiate a rolling restart.

The purpose of changing restartVersion is to trigger Inspector to do rolling restart per Tom and Johnny
recreate? or update?
I delete it first and then create it again. Should it be re-created?
this is a really nice test, i like this, i can read it understand the intent easily.
Thanks. I just added a python file to verify dsResource values like readTimeout, DS name, etc. Ready for the second test case :)

this is a really nice method, logs what it is doing, puts the command in a string, which it prints and execs, so no chance of someone coming along later and updating one but not the other, the assertion is specific and has a reasonable message.
Thanks,Mark for encouragement :)
should this be an assumption or an assertion?
You are right, should be assertion so that the failures can be registered as a failed test. fixed

nodes.bodyText: This method is there in MiiBaseTest.java, why do u need this here again?

modifyDomainYamlWithNewConfigMapAndDomainRestartVersion in MiiBaseTest.java does two things:

replace cm name with a new one
add restartVersion: v1.1

In my test,

I don't need to create a brand new cm, I just re-create the existing one, so "replacing cm with a new name" doesn't apply to my test
restartVersion is hard coded, I need it to be flex for later test case.

I can move modifyDomainYamlWithRestartVersion() in my test suite to MiiBaseTest.java though, if you like. Just let me know.
Check MiiBaseTest.createMIIDomainWithConfigMap()
When I started coding, this method doesn't existing and I need the model files to be passed as params. Good we have it now. Will change to use it. Thanks
Check MiiBaseTest.modifyDomainYamlWithNewConfigMapAndDomainRestartVersion(), if you want you can refactor it or add another method in MiiBaseTest as you need these methods in other MII tests also.
Ok. Will move my to MiiBaseTerst.java. Thanks

In the method modifyDomainYamlWithRestartVersion can't we use  kubectl patch command to update the Restart Version instead of modifying the domain.yaml file. We can get the current version and add +1 to it.  No need to get VersionNumber parameter. It will be easier to port to Junit5 where we will be using kubectl API.
